page.title: 07THE COURT LEET
page.content: THE COURT LEET IS THE RESULT OF THE FREEDOM GIVEN IN 1290 FOR ALTRINCHAM TO ADMINISTER ITS OWN LOCAL JUSTICE. ALTRINCHAM IS A{CHARTER TOWN}WHICH MEANS THAT THE FREEDOM OF ITS PEOPLE CANNOT BE TAKEN AWAY. IN 1973, ALTRINCHAM BECAME PART OF THE {METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF TRAFFORD.}SO THAT THE CHARTER WOULD NOT BE FORGOTTEN, A GROUP OF BUSINESS MEN CAME TOGETHER TO REFORM THE {COURT {LEET}IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE MEMORY OF THE FREEDOM GRANTED TO THE PEOPLE OF ALTRINCHAM. ONE SUNDAY A YEAR,{THE CONSTABLE,} DRESSED IN A GREEN CLOAK,WILL {"BEAT {THE BOUNDARIES"}OF ALTRINCHAM. IN THE{ALTRINCHAM FESTIVAL,}THE MEMBERS OF THE COURT LEET MARCH ALONG WEARING GREEN CLOAKS AND RED HATS. THEY ALSO WEAR CHAINS OF OFFICE BEARING THE{COAT OF ARMS.
